Key Match Events: The Thunder outrebounded the Knicks 13-6 in the fourth quarter.
Aaron Wiggins had 15 points alone in the final period.
The Knicks were 1-of-9 with an extra point on the line in the fourth.
The Thunder was awarded seven tries to the foul line in the fourth quarter.
The minus-18 margin on the fourth quarter scoreboard was the worst tally the Knicks have had in a game this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart said in the aftermath, 'We know we're a good team. We know we have to keep going. But in certain circumstances, it just wasn't a good game for us.'

Head coach Tom Thibodeau said, 'We had an eight-point lead going into the fourth, and the intensity of the fourth quarter is different. So we got to be ready for that and we fell short tonight but our bench is more than capable, our starters are more than capable.'
Josh Hart added, 'No positives. Just got to be better.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder's 14-game winning streak is extended.
The Knicks' nine-game winning streak is ended.
The Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had a 33-point outing.
The Knicks will visit Madison Square Garden next Friday to face the Thunder again.
Others: The Knicks' championship cause is questioned.
The Thunder's MVP contender Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had a strong performance.
The Knicks struggled with bench scoring and rebounding in the fourth quarter.
